citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)
citeinfo.title: United States Counties (Generalized), 2022

descript.abstract: U.S. Counties - Generalized represents the counties (or county equivalents) of the United States in the 50 states and the District of Columbia. U.S. Counties - Generalized are polygons containing population totals from the 2020 Census.
descript.purpose: U.S. Counties - Generalized provides 2020 U.S. Census codes and population information, and generalized county (or county equivalent) boundaries to improve draw performance and be used effectively at a national level.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this dataset was first extracted from the ArcUSA 1:25M database and generalized. It has been edited since in various places. The positional accuracy is unknown.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Copied the Data and Maps 2021 U.S. Counties (Generalized). Referenced the Data and Maps 2022 U.S. Counties and updated the line work where it had changed. Removed all fields except FIPS and joined the fields from the Data and Maps 2022 U.S. Counties.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the counties (or county equivalents) within the United States. The primary legal divisions of most states are termed counties. In Louisiana, these divisions are known as parishes. In Alaska, which has no counties, the equivalent entities are the organized boroughs, city and boroughs, municipalities, and census areas. In the states Maryland, Missouri, Nevada, and Virginia, there are one or more incorporated places that are independent of any county organization and, thus, constitute primary divisions of their states. These incorporated places are known as independent cities and are treated as equivalent entities for purposes of data presentation. The District of Columbia has no primary divisions, and is considered an equivalent entity for purposes of data presentation in decennial censuses. All of the counties in Connecticut and Rhode Island and nine counties in Massachusetts were dissolved as functioning governmental entities; however, the U.S. Census Bureau continues to present data for these historical entities in order to provide comparable geographic units at the county level of the geographic hierarchy for these states and represents them as nonfunctioning legal entities in data products.
enttyp.enttypds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 31-2009, (Formerly FIPS 6-4) Codes for the Identification of Counties and Equivalent Areas of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The name for the state in which the county is located.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the county is located.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The code (two-digit number) for the state in which the county is located.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The code (three-digit number) for the county.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 31-2009, (Formerly FIPS 6-4) Codes for the Identification of Counties and Equivalent Areas of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The combined state and county codes. County codes begin with 001 for each state; use the combined code (five-digit number) to uniquely identify a county in the country.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas; INCITS 31-2009, (Formerly FIPS 6-4) Codes for the Identification of Counties and Equivalent Areas of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attrdomv.udom: Populations for the features. A <Null> value means no data.

attr.attrdef: The 2020 population of the county per square mile.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau; Esri

attrdomv.udom: Calculated populations per square mile for the features. A <Null> value means no data.

attr.attrdef: The area of the county in square miles using the North America Albers Equal Area Conic projection.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
